meanings.definition: The act of making a loud, high-pitched sound
meanings.sent1: The screamings of the children filled the playground with noise.
meanings.sent2: The screamings of the sirens could be heard from far away.
meanings.sent3: The screamings of the monkeys in the zoo made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The screamings of the wind through the trees sounded like a haunted house.
meanings.sent5: The screamings of the tea kettle on the stove warned that it was boiling.

meanings.definition: A series of loud, high-pitched sounds
meanings.sent1: The screamings of the fireworks lit up the night sky.
meanings.sent2: The screamings of the car alarms startled the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The screamings of the teapot as it boiled were like a tiny concert.
meanings.sent4: The screamings of the seagulls overhead echoed across the beach.
meanings.sent5: The screamings of the tea kettle were a reminder to make a cup of tea.

meanings.definition: The act of shouting or crying out in a loud voice
meanings.sent1: The screamings of the protesters could be heard throughout the city.
meanings.sent2: The screamings of the coach on the field motivated the team to win.
meanings.sent3: The screamings of the parrot mimicking its owner were quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The screamings of the thunderstorm outside matched the chaos within.
meanings.sent5: The screamings of the baby for attention were impossible to ignore.
